plantuml_diagram:
@startuml
!define AWSPuml https://raw.githubusercontent.com/awslabs/aws-icons-for-plantuml/v20.0/dist
!include AWSPuml/AWSCommon.puml

title React SPA (Create React App) - High Level Deployment

skinparam shadowing false
skinparam componentStyle rectangle
skinparam wrapWidth 220
skinparam maxMessageSize 120

node "User Device" as user {
  artifact "Web Browser\n(Chrome/Firefox/Safari)" as browser
}

cloud "Internet" as internet

node "Hosting / CDN" as hosting {
  artifact "Static Assets\nHTML/CSS/JS\nReact SPA build" as static
  artifact "Web Server\n(Nginx or CDN origin)" as webserver
}

cloud "External Services" as ext {
  component "External HTTP APIs\n(3rd-party / backend)" as apis
}

browser --> internet : HTTPS
internet --> webserver : HTTPS GET /index.html, /static/*
webserver --> static : serves
browser --> apis : HTTPS (axios)

note right of hosting
Build pipeline (out of scope):
- Node.js + react-scripts
- Tailwind CSS build
- Produces static bundle
end note

note bottom of hosting
Container option (Dockerfile):
- Node.js base image
- Builds CRA bundle
- Serves via web server in container
end note

@enduml

architecture_description:
## High-level architecture (deployment)

### 1) Client (React SPA)
- **Technology**: JavaScript/HTML/CSS, **React 18** (Create React App via `react-scripts`), **React Router**, **Redux Toolkit** (+ `react-redux`), **Tailwind CSS**.
- **Runtime**: Executes in the **end-userâ€™s web browser**.
- **Behavior**:
  - Loads static assets (HTML/JS/CSS) from hosting.
  - Makes outbound **HTTPS** calls to **external HTTP APIs** using **axios**.

### 2) Static hosting / CDN + Web server
- **What it serves**: The built SPA bundle (e.g., `index.html`, `/static/*` assets).
- **Implementation options**:
  - **CDN + origin** (typical for SPAs) or a simple **Nginx** static web server.
  - The repository includes a **Dockerfile**, indicating a **containerized** option where a Node.js-based build produces the static bundle and a web server serves it.

### 3) External HTTP APIs (3rd-party or separate backend)
- **Role**: Provides data/services consumed by the SPA.
- **Integration**: Direct browser-to-API calls over **HTTPS** (subject to CORS/auth patterns).

### Key relationships
- Browser retrieves SPA assets from Hosting/CDN over **HTTPS**.
- SPA (in browser) calls External APIs over **HTTPS** via **axios**.
- Hosting/Web server serves the static build artifacts produced by the build process (Node.js + `react-scripts` + Tailwind build).
